comments.body: It would be slightly cheaper to cache these mask filters somewhere static (e.g., in shadows.dart), but this is fine for now.
Let's not worry about the cache then.  We can come back to it if necessary.
Oops, I have been misled by the parameter name. I thought it was an _other_ `FractionalOffset` . Sorry.

I probably would have written this as an if.  It's not like someone is going to miss this when adding a new border style.  By contrast, the lerp might be a good place to use a switch because you want to draw the developer's attention there.

I used a switch to help copypasta authors catch when their code misses a new style.

This isn't academic, I promptly copied and pasted this code into my table border drawing code. :-)
I updated the lerp for borderside to be better and it now uses a switch.
Is this needed?  I would have thought we'd be filling the paths here.

It's so that I don't have to set it whenever I set the style to stroke. I can move it to the four branches below if that'd be better. (I believe it's ignored in fill mode, which we use if not doing a hairline.)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +247,251 @@
    Paint paint = new Paint()
      ..strokeWidth = 0.0; // used for hairline borders
    Path path;
